page.title: 14THE MIRACULOUS BEAM.
page.content: { The legend of Christchurch Priory. The year was 1095 and workmen were building a new Priory,so that defences could be stiffened.For such people as priests (who chanted services for hours at a time) transepts were built. It was at this finishing stage,that a tired carpenter,accidently cut a beam too short.After it had been reported to the chief,who was none too pleased, it was decided to finish for the night and begin again the next day.The following morning,the workmen arrived as usual and were mystified to see that the beam which had been cut too short the night before,had vanished. The carpenters rushed to where the beam should have originally gone,and they were astonished to find it,in its place and too long.Many people believed that it was the work of God, but we will never know for certain.
